item.title: Will they or won’t they? Japan uses guessing game to shore up yen
item.dc:creator: Ramisa Tasnim
item.description:
Reuters took readers on a deep dive into how Japanese authorities are relying heavily on psychological tactics to fight yen […]

The post Will they or won’t they? Japan uses guessing game to shore up yen appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters took readers on a deep dive into how Japanese authorities are relying heavily on psychological tactics to fight yen bears, which means keeping markets guessing about their foreign exchange intervention rather than overt attempts to arrest the currency’s decline to multi-decade lows.

The post Will they or won’t they? Japan uses guessing game to shore up yen appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

item.title: Reuters reveals Indonesia’s defences start crumbling against relentless dollar
item.dc:creator: Ramisa Tasnim
item.description:
Reuters exclusively reported Indonesia’s currency is tumbling and foreign money in its bond markets is heading for the exits, stoking […]

The post Reuters reveals Indonesia’s defences start crumbling against relentless dollar appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters exclusively reported Indonesia’s currency is tumbling and foreign money in its bond markets is heading for the exits, stoking fears that Southeast Asia’s largest economy is finally starting to crack after months of remarkable resilience against global headwinds. 

The post Reuters reveals Indonesia’s defences start crumbling against relentless dollar appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

item.title: Reuters reveals Argentina central bank pauses rate hikes after inflation undershoot
item.dc:creator: Ramisa Tasnim
item.description:
Reuters exclusively reported Argentina’s central bank board was set to keep the benchmark interest rate steady at 75% as September […]

The post Reuters reveals Argentina central bank pauses rate hikes after inflation undershoot appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters exclusively reported Argentina’s central bank board was set to keep the benchmark interest rate steady at 75% as September inflation data came in lower than expected. The bank confirmed the news on Tuesday. The decision to hold the rate unchanged breaks one of the world’s most aggressive tightening cycles in the inflation-hit South American country where prices are set to rise around 100% this year.

The post Reuters reveals Argentina central bank pauses rate hikes after inflation undershoot appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

item.title: Reuters reveals Bank of England stands firm on deadline for bond purchases; sterling slides to two-week low
item.dc:creator: Ramisa Tasnim
item.description:
Reuters was first to report that the Bank of England had no intention of extending purchases of bonds beyond the […]

The post Reuters reveals Bank of England stands firm on deadline for bond purchases; sterling slides to two-week low appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters was first to report that the Bank of England had no intention of extending purchases of bonds beyond the previously set deadline, hours after it expanded the programme to include inflation-linked debt. The sterling fell more than a cent against the U.S. dollar to its lowest since Sept. 29 after remarks by Bank of England Governor Andrew Bailey.

The post Reuters reveals Bank of England stands firm on deadline for bond purchases; sterling slides to two-week low appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

item.title: Reuters reveals Bank of England comment on interest rates; sterling falls
item.dc:creator: Ramisa Tasnim
item.description:
Reuters was first to report the Bank of England would not hesitate to change interest rates and was monitoring markets […]

The post Reuters reveals Bank of England comment on interest rates; sterling falls appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters was first to report the Bank of England would not hesitate to change interest rates and was monitoring markets “very closely” after the pound plunged to a record low in response to the new government’s financial plans. The sterling fell about 1.5% against the U.S. dollar to $1.0671 from $1.082 before the Bank of England statement

The post Reuters reveals Bank of England comment on interest rates; sterling falls appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

item.title: Reuters reveals BOJ is nowhere near shifting monetary policy to support yen
item.dc:creator: Ramisa Tasnim
item.description:
Reuters revealed that the yen may be near 24-year lows, but Japan’s central bank is not even close to trying […]

The post Reuters reveals BOJ is nowhere near shifting monetary policy to support yen appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters revealed that the yen may be near 24-year lows, but Japan’s central bank is not even close to trying to support it with higher interest rates. The government — especially the Ministry of Finance — has repeatedly and strongly expressed dissatisfaction with this year’s falls in the yen, which on Sept. 7 dropped as far as 144.990 per dollar, down 30% since the end of 2021.

The post Reuters reveals BOJ is nowhere near shifting monetary policy to support yen appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

item.title: Reuters reveals Qatar tells local banks to stop currency swap deals abroad
item.dc:creator: Ramisa Tasnim
item.description:
Reuters exclusively reported Qatar’s central bank has told banks in the Gulf state not to exchange its currency with entities […]

The post Reuters reveals Qatar tells local banks to stop currency swap deals abroad appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters exclusively reported Qatar’s central bank has told banks in the Gulf state not to exchange its currency with entities outside the country without prior permission, in a move bankers say aims at ending the riyal’s divergence against the dollar. The Qatari riyal, officially fixed at 3.64 to the dollar since 2001, has in the offshore market been quoted below its peg for the most part since mid-2017 when four Arab states boycotted Doha in a political row, which was resolved in early 2021.

The post Reuters reveals Qatar tells local banks to stop currency swap deals abroad appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
